metadata.title: CVE-2023-5388 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
NSS was susceptible to a timing side-channel attack when performing RSAdecryption. This attack could potentially allow an attacker to recover theprivate data. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124, Firefox ESR <115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5388` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.98-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.98-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.98-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
